## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hi, I have a few questions about Verus. First, what is the purpose of the monthly recap on Medium, and why is it not available through a newsletter?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, the monthly recap on Medium is available through a newsletter as well. In fact, the same content is sent through the newsletter as is published on Medium. So, you can stay updated on Verus news and developments through either medium.

**User:**
That's good to know, thanks! I was also wondering about the multi-chain testnet. Is it still active, and has the bridge to the Rinkeby testnet been released?

**AI Assistant:**
The multi-chain testnet has actually been reset in preparation for the bridge to the Rinkeby testnet. While it's said that the release is close, it hasn't happened yet. We're all waiting for the update, but it's not quite here yet.

**User:**
Got it, thanks for the update. I've also seen some mentions of Verus Desktop and CLI wallet updates. Are these updates mandatory for all users?

**AI Assistant:**
No, the Verus Desktop and CLI wallet updates are highly recommended but non-mandatory. However, they are critical for notaries and pools, so if you're involved in those areas, you should definitely make sure to update.

**User:**
Okay, that's good to know. I've heard some rumors about Verus being rejected from integrating with OpenID and Bluesky. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not true at all. Verus has actually been selected to start a workgroup to integrate with OpenID, and its lead developer Mike Toutonghi has had conversations with Bluesky about the benefits of integrating Verus and VerusID with their project. So, things are moving forward on that front!
What is the purpose of the monthly recap on Medium, and why is it not available through a newsletter?
The monthly recap on Medium is also available through a newsletter. In fact, the same content is sent through the newsletter as is published on Medium.

Next to publishing the monthly recap on Medium, I will send the exact same content through a newsletter. Subscribe here. I’ll try to keep things short and to the point. So let’s get started with the very first monthly recap.
August 2021
Preparing Testnet for Ethereum Bridge
The multi-chain testnet has been reset. This in preperation for the bridge to the Rinkeby testnet. It has been said we are very close to this game-changing release.
Wallet Updates
Highly recommended non-mandatory Verus Desktop and CLI wallet updates have been made available. (Critical for notaries and pools). Download v0.7.4 here
Conversations with Mike & Bluesky
Bluesky is an initiative from Twitter to create a decentralized social media platform. Verus lead developer Mike Toutonghi had some very interesting posts in their Discord channel explaining the benefits that Verus and VerusID can bring to their project. Everyone in their Discord is still shell-shocked from the bombs that Mike dropped on them. Read a part of the messages here. Verus has been selected to start a workgroup to integrate with OpenID. The future will tell if it is something worthwhile. One big positive is that more people, and especially developers, will learn about Verus. You can read all the messages back in the Bluesky Discord, and please keep the shilling to yourself. We want to foster professional and productive environments.Giant Website Overhaul
We are close to finishing a giant website overhaul. Better, more concise messaging. Easier to understand copywriting. More illustrations. Clearer design. All-in-all easier to digest for all people. I personally can’t wait for it to be online. I believe it to be a great improvement that will definitely get more people more interested in Verus.
